quote_first: As they passed the common a quick glance at the clock in the Town Hall gave them the time. It was just
quote_last:
.
“You’ll be cold,” said Tom, as he noted that Willard had no overcoat on.
“No, I won’t; not very. There wasn’t time to find anything.” Willard dropped his voice. “How badly is he hurt, Tom?”
title: Benton's Venture
author: Ralph Henry Barbour

quote_last: ,” said Arthur, in a voice which combined reproach and terror. And he sprang out of bed and began with hysteric fury to sort out his garments.
title: Catching the Train
author: Arnold Bennett

quote_last: when I got to Mr. and Mrs. Fleming’s house on 6th Street, where I was renting a room. It was late September, and though there was some sun left, I didn’t want to visit a dead man’s place with night coming on.
title: All Aunt Hagar's Children
author: Edward P. Jones
